title: Meet the Edifier NeoDots Earbuds: Hybrid ANC, 17-Hour Battery, and More
description: Priced at $129, the Edifier NeoDots come with a wide set of features. The post Meet the Edifier NeoDots Earbuds: Hybrid ANC, 17-Hour Battery, and More appeared first on Phandroid.
author: Mike Viray
excerpt: Priced at $129, the Edifier NeoDots come with a wide set of features.
text: Veteran electronics brand Edifier is certainly no stranger to audio gear, and its newest launch expands its wireless audio lineup. Priced at $129, the Edifier NeoDots come with a wide set of features that according to the company promise good sound quality. The NeoDots pack Hi-Res Audio Wireless certification, and come with balanced armature and 10mm dynamic drivers that work in tandem with advanced digital signal processing. There’s support for LDAC, AAC, and SBC codecs as well. Of course, active noise cancellation is likewise present, and the earbuds are capable of -48dB noise reduction. Users can also get up to 17 hours of playtime on a single charge (longer than most earbuds out there), with a total of 56 hours when using the charging case. A 15-minute top-up can also get you an additional 5 hours of use. Other features include built-in game mode with 80ms low latency, Bluetooth v5.4 compatibility, touch controls and wear detection. The Edifier NeoDots are available for order with select retailers starting today, and you can also check them out via Amazon using the link below. Note: this article may contain affiliate links that help support our authors and keep the Phandroid servers running. A writer and content creator with a love for tech and music, Mike is also an avid gamer as well. He and his wife are big fans of Mario Kart. html:
Veteran electronics brand Edifier is certainly no stranger to audio gear, and its newest launch expands its wireless audio lineup. Priced at $129, the Edifier NeoDots come with a wide set of features that according to the company promise good sound quality.

The NeoDots pack Hi-Res Audio Wireless certification, and come with balanced armature and 10mm dynamic drivers that work in tandem with advanced digital signal processing. There’s support for LDAC, AAC, and SBC codecs as well. Of course, active noise cancellation is likewise present, and the earbuds are capable of -48dB noise reduction.

Users can also get up to 17 hours of playtime on a single charge (longer than most earbuds out there), with a total of 56 hours when using the charging case. A 15-minute top-up can also get you an additional 5 hours of use. Other features include built-in game mode with 80ms low latency, Bluetooth v5.4 compatibility, touch controls and wear detection.

The Edifier NeoDots are available for order with select retailers starting today, and you can also check them out via Amazon using the link below.
